title: A Whale of a Tale, Magical Bridge Design Playground
blurb: Intergenerational playground at National Museum of Singapore
description: Located near the Front Lawn, the playground reimagines the iconic blue whale skeleton once displayed at the museum. Designed by Magical Bridge Foundation, it incorporates nostalgic details such as mosaic tiles inspired by some of the iconic playgrounds of our yesteryear. Built for people of all ages and abilities with accessible equipment that has features attuned to the needs of both young and old, and encourages intergenerational bonding. This includes senior-friendly workout areas, sensory play features, and picnic benches for everyone to enjoy. A family-friendly space for all.
datetime_display: friendly workout areas, sensory play features, and picnic benches for everyone to enjoy
Keyword_tag: Intergenerational playground, accessible playground, sensory play, family-friendly, National Museum of Singapore

title: A Playground for All at National Museum Singapore
description: The first intergenerational playground at a museum in Singapore, reimagining the iconic blue whale skeleton once displayed at the museum. Designed by Magical Bridge Foundation and sponsored by Amanda Toh-Steckler and the late Vince Steckler, the playground incorporates nostalgic details such as mosaic tiles inspired by iconic playgrounds. It is built for people of all ages and abilities with accessible equipment that has features attuned to the needs of both young and old, and encourages intergenerational bonding. Features include senior-friendly workout areas, sensory play features, and picnic benches for everyone to enjoy.
Keyword_tag: playground, intergenerational, museum, accessible, sensory play, workout areas
